trial_identification.studytitle: Evaluation of a falls education program in Victoria comparing traditional face-to-face facilitation with e-mail based facilitation
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Comparing online versus face-to-face facilitation of an education program for physiotherapists, occupational therapists, and nurses, addressing exercise prescription for falls prevention, on course satisfaction, knowledge and perceived change in clinical performance.

interventions.interventions:
Online Education Program in Exercise Prescription for Falls Prevention.
The online education program will be delivered via the 'Moodle' online learning system, with 4 x 2 hour sessions, followed by a multiple choice question examination, and a course evaluation survey.
This mode of delivery will involve no face-to-face contact between faciliator and participant.
interventions.comparator:
Face-to-face Education Program in Exercise Prescription for Falls Prevention.
This program will be delivered as a single 8 hr 'workshop' to participants, followed by a multiple choice examination 2 weeks after completion of the course and a course evaluation survey.
All facilitation will be completed face-to-face.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Clinical Performance will be assessed via an anonymous online survey investigating what aspects of their clinical interaction with clientele has changed as a result of the program.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Learning experience/satisfaction will be assessed via an anonymous online survey that will focus on aspects of the short-course including preceptions of support, course content and suggestions for improvement.

Cost-effectiveness will be assessed via an anonymous online survey investigating willingness to pay for the educational product. Contributing to cost-effectinesss data will be a comparisons on cost of course construction and delivery between theonline and face-to-face facilitated programs.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Current Practising Physiotherapist, Occupational Therapist, Nurse. Contact with patients at risk of falls Access to Internet
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Profession other than nurse, physiotherapist or occupational therapist. No access to internet. No interaction with falls risk clientele.

trial_design.concealment:
Participants will begin by completing a registration form which includes key data for stratifying randomised allocation. Stratification group one will be those who have less than two years of experience in this area and group two will be those who have two years or more of experience.
An investigator independent of the investigators collecting registration to participate will create a random number list and allocate on the basis of order of recruitment. This investigator will not be aware of participant demographics other than stratification category when making this allocation.
Investigators involved in recruitment and receipt of participant registrations will not be aware of the content of the random allocation sequence.
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by using a randomised table created by computer software.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: In this study we are seeking to evaluate the implementation of an education program addressing exercise prescription for falls prevention designed for health professionals in regional Victoria. In particular, a face-to-face mode of facilitation will be compared with online based facilitation.
